Thank you to the community of #Silverdale, Newcastle-under-Lyme for reporting a water pipe discharging near #WalleysQuarry landfill. Our officers are attending the @RedIndustries2 site to investigate.

tweets.text: @SianieRoo @EnvAgency HOWEVER they have vastly underestimated the power of the people CLEARLY. I feel the time is up on whatever is happening here . @StinkStopthe is growing in support against this place daily and will be on their arse until a resolve is found üí™üèΩ #capitoff #byebyeredindustries üëãüèΩ
@StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off @EnvAgencyMids no more favouring big businesses start looking after your people. We aren‚Äôt going away üò° we won‚Äôt be fobbed off https://t.co/cxMDzuRM7g
@StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off @EnvAgencyMids watching with baited breath ( literally ) for your next move . Let‚Äôs see if your going to actually do something üßêüßêüßêüßêüßê https://t.co/s5sIn1wuIp

@EnvAgencyMids @shamytaw @SianieRoo @JaneHawkins987 @maricaoneill @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 Can the Environment Agency do testing on soil samples from the surrounding fields especially the one with the pollution leak captured on video, that will count as another permit breach to add to the long list now!

Let‚Äôs not wait too long though-our children are breathing the fumes in every day & who knows what the long term effects will be. We need answers , a plan & timelines & in the meantime @PHE_EoEngland should be doing a LOT more than health surveillance @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency https://t.co/yvK7Tgh6V2
@CMPG @HighwaysWMIDS @EnvAgency Isn't it also an offence to use an ERA for a non-emergency ?
@CMPG @HighwaysWMIDS @EnvAgency Should make the dirty bastard collect rubbish all the way up the motorway

Climate friendly coffees are never shipped more than once, direct emission reductions by corporates must be the priority.

tweets.text: @Oikburd @mattscottphotos @EnvAgency Thanks. That‚Äôs my understanding too. I will just take the pics - like of the trees being felled this week by the NP sluice gate. It‚Äôs up to peeps to decide what it looks like. To me it‚Äôs horrendous and barren. No offset elsewhere can fix it for our birds here.

Over six years ago we predicted HS2 would make their application to @EnvAgency to approve tunnelling at the last moment and sure enough they have. Why did they do this? purely to avoid public scrutiny of this highly dubious activity that puts rivers and drinking water at risk.
